item.title: 默克公司以高达 13 亿美元的价格收购癌症疗法开发商 Modifi 生物科学公司
item.description: 默克公司以高达 13 亿美元的价格收购了 Modifi 生物科学公司，获得了其实验性癌症疗法的使用权，这家私营生物技术公司于周三表示。【原文：Merck has acquired Modifi Biosciences for as much as $1.3 billion, gaining access to its experimental cancer therapies, the privately held biotech firm said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 消息人士称，巴西 Azul 公司正在权衡筹集新资本的方案，交易有望达成
item.description: 三位接近讨论的消息人士告诉路透社，巴西 Azul 航空公司正在与多方谈判，希望通过债务融资筹集约 4 亿美元的新资金，协议最快可能在本周达成。【原文：Brazilian airline Azul is in talks with multiple parties to raise about $400 million in fresh capital via debt financing and an agreement may come as soon as this week, three sources close to the discussions told Reuters.】

item.title: 北方信托季度利润因资产管理费增加而大幅增长
item.description: 北方信托公司（Northern Trust）周三报告称，由于服务和管理客户资产的费用收入增加，该公司第三季度利润增长了 42%，使得这家资产和财富管理公司的股价在盘前交易中上涨了 4.4%。【原文：Northern Trust reported a 42% rise in third-quarter profit on Wednesday, on a higher fee income from servicing and managing client assets, sending the asset and wealth manager's shares up 4.4% in trading before the bell.】

item.title: 复古债券从 80 年代回归，加速债务重组，但代价不菲
item.description: 最近接二连三的国家债务违约事件让诞生于 20 世纪 80 年代、旨在加快债务重组的复杂证券重新流行起来。【原文：The recent cascade of countries defaulting on their debt has brought back into vogue complex securities - born in the 1980s - that aim to speed up restructurings.】

item.title: 联合利华第三季度价格调整可能吸引了购物者
item.description: 投资者正在关注联合利华周四公布的第三季度财报，以了解这家消费品集团在寻求平衡销售量和利润率的过程中，是否已开始夺回一些被廉价竞争对手夺走的市场份额。【原文：Investors are looking to Unilever's third-quarter results on Thursday to see if the consumer goods group has started to claw back some market share lost to cheaper rivals as it seeks to balance sales volumes and margins.】

item.title: NextEra 第三季度利润超出预期，得益于可再生能源的强劲增长
item.description: NextEra Energy 第三季度利润超过华尔街预期，得益于其可再生能源部门的强劲表现。【原文：NextEra Energy's third-quarter profit beat Wall Street estimates on Wednesday, helped by strength in its renewables unit.】

item.title: 汇丰银行首席执行官告诉员工，改革后高级裁员不可避免
item.description: 汇丰银行首席执行官乔治-埃尔德里（Georges Elhedery）在路透社周三看到的一份备忘录中告诉员工，在该行最新重组后，一些高级职员应做好裁员的准备。【原文：Some senior HSBC staff should brace for job cuts after the bank's latest restructuring, Chief Executive Georges Elhedery told staff in a memo seen by Reuters on Wednesday.】

item.title: 合同投票在即，波音首席执行官力促陷入困境的飞机制造商扭亏为盈
item.description: 波音公司首席执行官凯利-奥特伯格（Kelly Ortberg）周三提出了一项扭亏为盈计划，其中包括推动 "根本性的文化变革"，这家陷入困境的飞机制造商正在努力应对一场严重的罢工、不断增加的债务和加剧的现金消耗。【原文：Boeing CEO Kelly Ortberg laid out a turnaround plan on Wednesday, including a push for a "fundamental culture change," as the struggling planemaker grapples with a crippling strike, mounting debt and heightened cash burn.】

item.title: 通用动力公司收入因国防需求而增长
item.description: 通用动力公司（General Dynamics）周三公布的第三季度收入增长超过 10%，主要得益于其国防部门在军用弹药和车辆的持续需求中表现强劲。【原文：General Dynamics reported a more than 10% rise in third-quarter revenue on Wednesday, driven by strength in its defense units amid sustained demand for military munitions and vehicles.】

item.title: CME 集团利润因交易强劲而增长
item.description: 芝加哥商品交易所集团（CME Group）周三公布第三季度利润增长，原因是美国货币政策路径的不确定性导致投资者重新调整投资组合，从而促进了衍生品交易所的交易量。【原文：CME Group reported a rise in third-quarter profit on Wednesday, as uncertainty around the U.S. monetary policy path led investors to rejig their portfolio, bolstering trading volumes for the derivatives exchange.】

item.title: 可口可乐押注苏打水需求增长，预测收入激增
item.description: 可口可乐公司周三表示，由于美国、印度和韩国市场对其汽水和果汁的需求增长，该公司季度销售额出人意料地增长，预计全年有机产品销售额将达到之前的高端水平。【原文：Coca-Cola said on Wednesday it expects annual organic sales at high-end of its previous range after posting a surprise quarterly rise on growing demand for its sodas and juices in the U.S., India and South Korea.】

item.title: 工具和服务需求强劲，赛默飞上调盈利预期
item.description: 赛默飞世尔科技公司（Thermo Fisher Scientific）周三上调了其年度利润预期的下限，这是公司今年第三次调整该预期，并将赌注押在对其用于药物开发的工具和服务需求的增长上。【原文：Thermo Fisher Scientific on Wednesday raised the lower end of its annual profit forecast, tweaking it for the third time this year, betting on improved demand for its tools and services used in drug development.】

item.title: 美国电话电报公司（AT&T）无线用户数超预期，原因是对价格昂贵的无限制计划有需求
item.description: AT&T 在第三季度获得了比预期更多的无线用户，原因是其更高级的无限制计划得到了稳步采用，这些计划还提供了包括增加热点数据在内的优惠。【原文：AT&T gained more wireless subscribers than expected in the third quarter, driven by the steady adoption of its higher-tier unlimited plans that come with perks including increased hotspot data.】

item.title: 首席执行官称，英伟达 Blackwell AI 芯片的设计缺陷现已修复
item.description: 英伟达（Nvidia）首席执行官黄仁勋（Jensen Huang）周三表示，在台湾长期制造合作伙伴台积电（TSMC）的帮助下，已经修复了影响生产的最新 Blackwell AI 芯片的设计缺陷。【原文：Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang said on Wednesday a design flaw with its latest Blackwell AI chips which impacted production has been fixed with the help of longtime Taiwanese manufacturing partner TSMC .】

item.title: 独家报道：国家和行业意见促使美国农业机构放宽奶牛禽流感检测令
item.description: 根据路透社看到的州和联邦记录，美国农业部去年春天削弱了一项旨在防止禽流感在全国奶牛中传播的紧急命令。【原文：The U.S. Department of Agriculture weakened an emergency order last spring designed to prevent the spread of bird flu among the nation's dairy cattle after pushback from state and industry officials, according to state and federal records seen by Reuters.】

item.title: 西班尼公司在蒙大拿州的困境凸显了矿工对华盛顿的依赖与日俱增
item.description: 美国矿业项目越来越依赖华盛顿的财政支持来抵消全球竞争，上个月西班业公司（Sibanye Stillwater）因未能获得与《通货膨胀削减法案》（Inflation Reduction Act）相关的隐晦税收减免而决定解雇数百名蒙大拿州矿工，就凸显了这一现实。【原文：U.S. mining projects are growing reliant on Washington's financial support to offset global competition, a reality underscored by Sibanye Stillwater's decision last month to lay off hundreds of Montana miners after it failed to qualify for an obscure tax credit tied to the Inflation Reduction Act.】

item.title: 美国燃料制造商第三季度利润下降，原因是利润率和燃料需求下降
item.description: 能源分析师说，由于燃料需求疲软和新炼油能力的投产，美国炼油商第三季度的利润预计将比去年下降，原因是利润率减弱。【原文：U.S. oil refiners' third quarter profits are expected to fall from last year on weakening margins as fuel demand softened and new refining capacity came online, energy analysts said.】

item.title: 美国航空公司因对待残疾乘客问题被处以创纪录的 5000 万美元罚款
item.description: 美国运输部周三表示，将对美国航空公司处以创纪录的 5000 万美元罚款，原因是该公司对待残疾乘客的态度不佳，包括未能为一些残疾乘客提供足够的帮助，以及对轮椅处理不当。【原文：The U.S. Transportation Department on Wednesday said it was fining American Airlines a record $50 million for its treatment of disabled passengers, including failing to provide some with adequate assistance and mishandling wheelchairs.】

item.title: 2024 年巴西发行人的外债融资激增
item.description: 由于当地公司寻求为现有债务再融资或进行新投资，巴西发行人的外债融资再次激增，在 2024 年达到三年来的最高点。【原文：Foreign debt financing by Brazilian issuers is surging again, reaching a three-year high in 2024, as local companies seek to refinance existing obligations or make new investments.】

item.title: 消费者支出放缓，希尔顿下调 2024 年客房收入增长预期
item.description: 希尔顿全球公司（Hilton Worldwide）周三下调了全年客房收入增长预期的上限，原因是美国部分消费者在可支配收入下降的情况下减少了国内旅游支出。【原文：Hilton Worldwide lowered the upper end of its annual room revenue growth forecast on Wednesday, as some U.S. consumers cut back on domestic travel spending amid a drop in disposable income.】

item.title: 聚焦：大选临近，华尔街加强人员配置，预计交易将出现波动
item.description: 银行、经纪公司、投资经理和交易所都在增加人手，以应对大选日及前后的高交易量，预计随着选举结果的揭晓，市场将变得动荡不安。【原文：Banks, brokerages, investment managers and exchanges are adding staff to handle high trading volumes on and around Election Day with markets expected to become volatile as results come in.】

item.title: 早间竞价：美元搭乘收益率上升的顺风车，加拿大将放宽货币政策
item.description: Mike Dolan 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan】

item.title: 监督委员会称，Facebook 应继续发布讽刺哈里斯-瓦尔兹（Harris-Walz）捏乳头的帖子
item.description: Meta Platforms 监督委员会周三要求该公司继续在 Facebook 上发布一个帖子，将美国民主党总统候选人卡马拉-哈里斯（Kamala Harris）和她的竞选伙伴蒂姆-瓦尔兹（Tim Walz）的脸叠加到一张模仿《阿呆与阿瓜》的电影海报上，海报上的人物隔着衣服互相捏对方的乳头。【原文：Meta Platforms' Oversight Board on Wednesday told the company to keep up a Facebook post superimposing the faces of U.S. Democratic presidential candidate Kamala Harris and her running mate Tim Walz onto a parody "Dumb and Dumber" movie poster showing the characters pinching each other's nipples through their clothing.】

item.title: 文件显示，美国联邦储备委员会在 2020-2023 年对九名性骚扰员工进行了纪律处分
item.description: 根据美国联邦储备委员会上个月向路透社公布的一份文件，该央行在 2020 年至 2023 年期间收到了 11 起针对个人的性骚扰投诉，并因此对 9 名工作人员进行了纪律处分，其中 4 人被解雇。【原文：The U.S. Federal Reserve Board received 11 complaints against individuals alleging sexual harassment between 2020 and 2023 and disciplined nine staff members as a result, firing four of them, according to a document the central bank released to Reuters last month.】

item.title: 波音公司准备就工资协议进行工会投票，以结束代价高昂的罢工
item.description: 波音工厂的工人将于周三就一项新的合同提案进行投票，该提案可能会结束为期五周多的罢工，这对这家陷入困境的飞机制造商来说是一个关键时刻，因为它正在与日益加深的金融危机搏斗。【原文：Boeing factory workers will vote on Wednesday on a new contract proposal that could bring an end to a more than five-week strike, in a crucial moment for the troubled planemaker as it wrestles with a deepening financial crisis.】

item.title: 加拿大央行可能将基准借贷成本降低 50 个基点
item.description: 经济学家们表示，加拿大央行很可能在周三将其关键政策利率下调 50 个基点，因为近期有关通胀、经济增长和失业率的一系列数据要求更快地缓解消费者和企业的压力。【原文：The Bank of Canada is likely to cut its key policy rate by 50 basis points on Wednesday, as a slew of recent data on inflation, growth and unemployment calls for faster relief for consumers and businesses, economists said.】

item.title: 债券收益率上升，期货下跌；波音和可口可乐业绩值得期待
item.description: 美国股指期货周三下滑，原因是市场怀疑美联储将不再那么鸽派，这抬高了国债收益率，而投资者则在等待波音、可口可乐和特斯拉等公司的财报，以评估经济状况。【原文：U.S. stock index futures slipped on Wednesday as doubts of a less dovish Federal Reserve lifted Treasury yields, while investors awaited earnings reports from companies such as Boeing, Coca-Cola and Tesla to assess the state of the economy.】

item.title: 据《日经新闻》报道，特斯拉将通过 Yamada 连锁店在日本销售家用电池
item.description: 据《日经商业日报》周三报道，特斯拉将开始通过连锁电子商店 Yamada Denki 在日本销售其 Powerwall 家用电池系统。【原文：Tesla will start selling its Powerwall home battery system in Japan through electronics store chain Yamada Denki, the Nikkei business daily reported on Wednesday.】

item.title: 英伟达首席执行官：欧盟在人工智能投资方面落后于美国和中国
item.description: 人工智能芯片制造商英伟达公司（Nvidia）首席执行官周三表示，欧盟在人工智能投资方面远远落后于美国和中国。【原文：The European Union lags far behind the United States and China in investing in artificial intelligence, the CEO of AI chipmaker Nvidia said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 意大利 ABI 负责人称欧洲央行在并购问题上的干预对银行业联盟是致命的
item.description: 意大利银行业协会 ABI 负责人周三呼吁欧洲中央银行成为该行业交易的唯一决策者，并称为阻止一项交易而干预其独立性将是一个错误。【原文：The head of Italy's banking association ABI on Wednesday called for the European Central Bank to be the sole decision-maker over transactions in the industry, saying interfering with its independence to block one deal would be a mistake.】
